settings.name: FOV
settings.description:
Field Of View - how far away from your crosshair an entity can be before it's ignored.
360° = aims at entities all around you.

settings.name: Aim at
settings.description:
What point in the target's hitbox AimAssist should aim at.

§lAuto§r - Aims at the closest point of the target's hitbox.

§lHead§r - Aims at the target's eye position.

§lCenter§r - Aims at the center of the target's hitbox.

§lFeet§r - Aims at the bottom of the target's hitbox.

settings.name: Ignore mouse input
settings.description: Ignores some of your mouse input while AimAssist is aiming. This makes it harder for you to accidentally aim away from the target.

settings.name: Check line of sight
settings.description: Won't aim at entities behind blocks.

settings.name: Aim while blocking
settings.description: Keeps aiming at entities while you're blocking with a shield or using items.

settings.name: Filter players
settings.description: Won't attack other players.

settings.name: Filter sleeping
settings.description:
Won't attack sleeping players.

Useful for servers like Mineplex that place sleeping players on the ground to make them look like corpses.

settings.name: Filter flying
settings.description:
Won't attack players that are at least the given distance above ground.

Useful for servers that try to detect your hacks by placing a flying bot near you.

settings.name: Filter hostile mobs
settings.description:
Won't attack hostile mobs like zombies and creepers.

This filter does not affect endermen, non-brute piglins, and zombified piglins.

settings.name: Filter neutral mobs
settings.description:
When set to §lOn§r, neutral mobs won't be attacked at all.

When set to §lIf calm§r, neutral mobs won't be attacked until they attack first. Be warned that this filter cannot detect if the neutral mobs are attacking you or someone else.

When set to §lOff§r, this filter does nothing and neutral mobs can be attacked.

settings.name: Filter passive mobs
settings.description:
Won't attack animals like pigs and cows, ambient mobs like bats, and water mobs like fish, squid and dolphins.

This filter does not affect wolves, bees, polar bears, pufferfish, and villagers.

settings.name: Filter passive water mobs
settings.description:
Won't attack passive water mobs like fish, squid, dolphins and axolotls.

This filter does not affect guardians, drowned, and pufferfish.

settings.name: Filter babies
settings.description:
Won't attack baby pigs, baby villagers, etc.

This filter does not affect baby zombies and other hostile baby mobs.

settings.name: Filter bats
settings.description: Won't attack bats and any other "ambient" mobs that might be added by mods.

settings.name: Filter slimes
settings.description:
Won't attack slimes.

This filter does not affect magma cubes.

settings.name: Filter pets
settings.description: Won't attack tamed wolves, tamed horses, etc.

settings.name: Filter villagers
settings.description: Won't attack villagers and wandering traders.

settings.name: Filter zombie villagers
settings.description: Won't attack zombified villagers.

settings.name: Filter golems
settings.description: Won't attack iron golems and snow golems.

settings.name: Filter piglins
settings.description:
When set to §lOn§r, piglins won't be attacked at all.

When set to §lIf calm§r, piglins won't be attacked until they attack first. Be warned that this filter cannot detect if the piglins are attacking you or someone else.

When set to §lOff§r, this filter does nothing and piglins can be attacked.

This filter does not affect piglin brutes.

settings.name: Filter zombie piglins
settings.description:
When set to §lOn§r, zombified piglins won't be attacked at all.

When set to §lIf calm§r, zombified piglins won't be attacked until they attack first. Be warned that this filter cannot detect if the zombified piglins are attacking you or someone else.

When set to §lOff§r, this filter does nothing and zombified piglins can be attacked.

settings.name: Filter endermen
settings.description:
When set to §lOn§r, endermen won't be attacked at all.

When set to §lIf calm§r, endermen won't be attacked until they attack first. Be warned that this filter cannot detect if the endermen are attacking you or someone else.

When set to §lOff§r, this filter does nothing and endermen can be attacked.

settings.name: Filter shulkers
settings.description: Won't attack shulkers.

settings.name: Filter invisible
settings.description: Won't attack invisible entities.

settings.name: Filter named
settings.description: Won't attack name-tagged entities.

settings.name: Filter shulker bullets
settings.description: Won't attack shulker bullets.

settings.name: Filter armor stands
settings.description: Won't attack armor stands.

settings.name: Filter end crystals
settings.description: Won't attack end crystals.

settings.name: Guide
settings.description: Shows a guide for where blocks will be placed.

settings.name: Guide color
settings.description: Color of the block placing guide, if enabled.

settings.name: Range
settings.description: Determines how far AnchorAura will reach to place, charge and detonate anchors.

settings.name: Auto-place anchors
settings.description:
When enabled, AnchorAura will automatically place anchors near valid entities.
When disabled, AnchorAura will only charge and detonate manually placed anchors.

settings.name: Face anchors
settings.description:
Whether or not AnchorAura should face the correct direction when placing and right-clicking respawn anchors.

Slower but can help with anti-cheat plugins.

settings.name: Check line of sight
settings.description:
Ensures that you don't reach through blocks when placing or right-clicking respawn anchors.

Slower but can help with anti-cheat plugins.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How AnchorAura should swing your hand when placing, charging and detonating respawn anchors.

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Take items from
settings.description: Where to look for respawn anchors and glowstone.

settings.name: Filter players
settings.description:
Won't target other players when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter hostile mobs
settings.description:
Won't target hostile mobs like zombies and creepers when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

This filter does not affect endermen, non-brute piglins, and zombified piglins.

settings.name: Filter neutral mobs
settings.description:
Won't target neutral mobs like endermen and wolves when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter passive mobs
settings.description:
Won't target animals like pigs and cows, ambient mobs like bats, and water mobs like fish, squid and dolphins when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

This filter does not affect wolves, bees, polar bears, pufferfish, and villagers.

settings.name: Filter passive water mobs
settings.description:
Won't target passive water mobs like fish, squid, dolphins and axolotls when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

This filter does not affect guardians, drowned, and pufferfish.

settings.name: Filter bats
settings.description:
Won't target bats and any other "ambient" mobs when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter slimes
settings.description:
Won't target slimes when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

This filter does not affect magma cubes.

settings.name: Filter villagers
settings.description:
Won't target villagers and wandering traders when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter zombie villagers
settings.description:
Won't target zombified villagers when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter golems
settings.description:
Won't target iron golems and snow golems when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter piglins
settings.description:
Won't target piglins when auto-placing anchors.

This filter does not affect piglin brutes.

settings.name: Filter zombie piglins
settings.description:
Won't target zombified piglins when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter shulkers
settings.description:
Won't target shulkers when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter allays
settings.description:
Won't target allays when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter invisible
settings.description:
Won't target invisible entities when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter named
settings.description:
Won't target name-tagged entities when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Filter armor stands
settings.description:
Won't target armor stands when auto-placing anchors.

They can still take damage if they get too close to a valid target or an existing anchor.

settings.name: Use AI
settings.description:
Uses a pathfinding AI to move around naturally and avoid hazards.
Can sometimes get stuck.

settings.name: AI range
settings.description: The area in which AntiAFK can move when Use AI is turned on.

settings.name: Non-AI range
settings.description:
The area in which AntiAFK can move when Use AI is turned off.

§c§lWARNING:§r This area must be completely unobstructed and free of hazards.

settings.name: Wait time
settings.description: Time between movements in seconds.

settings.name: Wait time randomization
settings.description: How much time can be randomly added or subtracted from the wait time, in seconds.

settings.name: Show wait time
settings.description: Displays the remaining wait time in the HackList.

settings.name: Horizontal Strength
settings.description:
How far to reduce horizontal knockback.
-100% = double knockback
0% = normal knockback
100% = no knockback
>100% = reverse knockback

settings.name: Vertical Strength
settings.description:
How far to reduce vertical knockback.
-100% = double knockback
0% = normal knockback
100% = no knockback
>100% = reverse knockback

settings.name: Prevent slowdown
settings.description:
Allows you to walk underwater at full speed.
Some servers consider this a speedhack.

settings.name: Strength
settings.description: Strength of the effect. 10 is the highest possible as of Minecraft 1.21.

settings.name: Trident yeet mode
settings.description:
When enabled, tridents fly much further. Doesn't seem to affect damage or Riptide.

§c§lWARNING:§r You can easily lose your trident by enabling this option!

settings.name: Use enchantments
settings.description: Whether or not to consider the Protection enchantment when calculating armor strength.

settings.name: Swap while moving
settings.description:
Whether or not to swap armor pieces while the player is moving.

§c§lWARNING:§r This would not be possible without cheats. It may raise suspicion.

settings.name: Delay
settings.description: Amount of ticks to wait before swapping the next piece of armor.

settings.name: Template
settings.description:
Determines what to build.

Templates are just JSON files. Feel free to add your own or to edit / delete the default templates.

If you mess up, simply press the 'Reset to Defaults' button or delete the folder.

settings.name: Range
settings.description:
How far to reach when placing blocks.
Recommended values:
6.0 for vanilla
4.25 for NoCheat+

settings.name: Check line of sight
settings.description: Makes sure that you don't reach through walls when placing blocks. Can help with AntiCheat plugins but slows down building.

settings.name: InstaBuild
settings.description:
Builds small templates (<= 64 blocks) instantly.
For best results, stand close to the block you're placing.

settings.name: Always FastPlace
settings.description: Builds as if FastPlace was enabled, even if it's not.

settings.name: OpenAI model
settings.description:
The model to use for OpenAI API calls.
Recommended models:

§lGPT-4o-2024-08-06§r is one of the smartest models at the time of writing and will often produce the best completions. However, it's meant to be an assistant rather than an auto-completion system, so you will see it produce some odd completions at times.

§lGPT-3.5-Turbo-Instruct§r is an older, non-chat model based on GPT-3.5 that works well for auto-completion tasks.

settings.name: Max tokens
settings.description:
The maximum number of tokens that the model can generate.

Higher values allow the model to predict longer chat messages, but also increase the time it takes to generate predictions.

The default value of 16 is fine for most use cases.

settings.name: Temperature
settings.description: Controls the model's creativity and randomness. A higher value will result in more creative and sometimes nonsensical completions, while a lower value will result in more boring completions.

settings.name: Top P
settings.description:
An alternative to temperature. Makes the model less random by only letting it choose from the most likely tokens.

A value of 100% disables this feature by letting the model choose from all tokens.

settings.name: Presence penalty
settings.description:
Penalty for choosing tokens that already appear in the chat history.

Positive values encourage the model to use synonyms and talk about different topics. Negative values encourage the model to repeat the same word over and over again.

settings.name: Frequency penalty
settings.description:
Similar to presence penalty, but based on how often the token appears in the chat history.

Positive values encourage the model to use synonyms and talk about different topics. Negative values encourage the model to repeat existing chat messages.

settings.name: Stop sequence
settings.description:
Controls how AutoComplete detects the end of a chat message.

§lLine Break§r is the default value and is recommended for most language models.

§lNext Message§r works better with certain code-optimized language models, which have a tendency to insert line breaks in the middle of a chat message.

settings.name: Context length
settings.description:
Controls how many messages from the chat history are used to generate predictions.

Higher values improve the quality of predictions, but also increase the time it takes to generate them, as well as cost (for APIs like OpenAI) or RAM usage (for self-hosted models).

settings.name: Filter server messages
settings.description:
Only shows player-made chat messages to the model.

This can help you save tokens and get more out of a low context length, but it also means that the model will have no idea about events like players joining, leaving, dying, etc.

settings.name: Custom model
settings.description:
If set, this model will be used instead of the one specified in the "OpenAI model" setting.

Use this if you have a fine-tuned OpenAI model or if you are using a custom endpoint that is OpenAI-compatible but offers different models.

settings.name: Custom model type
settings.description:
Whether the custom model should use the chat endpoint or the legacy endpoint.

If "Custom model" is left blank, this setting is ignored.

settings.name: OpenAI chat endpoint
settings.description: Endpoint for OpenAI's chat completion API.

settings.name: OpenAI legacy endpoint
settings.description: Endpoint for OpenAI's legacy completion API.

settings.name: Max suggestions per draft
settings.description: How many suggestions the AI is allowed to generate for the same draft message.

settings.name: Max suggestions kept
settings.description: Maximum number of suggestions kept in memory.

settings.name: Max suggestions shown
settings.description:
How many suggestions can be shown above the chat box.

If this is set too high, the suggestions will obscure some of the existing chat messages. How high you can set this depends on your screen resolution and GUI scale.

settings.name: Items
settings.description: Unwanted items that will be dropped.

settings.name: Target hunger
settings.description: Tries to keep the hunger bar at or above this level, but only if it doesn't waste any hunger points.

settings.name: Min hunger
settings.description:
Always keeps the hunger bar at or above this level, even if it wastes some hunger points.
6.5 - Cannot cause any waste with vanilla food items.
10.0 - Completely ignores waste and just keeps the hunger bar full.

settings.name: Injured hunger
settings.description:
Fills the hunger bar to at least this level when you are injured, even if it wastes some hunger points.
10.0 - fastest healing
9.0 - slowest healing
<9.0 - no healing
<3.5 - no sprinting

settings.name: Injury threshold
settings.description: Prevents small injuries from wasting all your food. AutoEat will only consider you injured if you have lost at least this number of hearts.

settings.name: Take items from
settings.description: Where AutoEat should look for food.

settings.name: Eat while walking
settings.description: Slows you down, not recommended.

settings.name: Allow hunger effect
settings.description:
Rotten flesh applies a harmless "hunger" effect.
It is safe to eat and useful as emergency food.

settings.name: Allow poison effect
settings.description:
Poisonous food applies damage over time.
Not recommended.

settings.name: Allow chorus fruit
settings.description:
Eating chorus fruit teleports you to a random location.
Not recommended.

settings.name: Bite mode
settings.description:
§lSound§r mode detects bites by listening for the bite sound. This method is less accurate, but is more resilient against anti-cheats. See the "Valid range" setting.

§lEntity§r mode detects bites by checking for the fishing hook's entity update packet. It's more accurate than the sound method, but is less resilient against anti-cheats.

settings.name: Valid range
settings.description:
Any bites that occur outside of this range will be ignored.

Increase your range if bites are not being detected, decrease it if other people's bites are being detected as yours.

This setting has no effect when "Bite mode" is set to "Entity".

settings.name: Catch delay
settings.description: How long AutoFish will wait after a bite before reeling in.

settings.name: Retry delay
settings.description: If casting or reeling in the fishing rod fails, this is how long AutoFish will wait before trying again.

settings.name: Patience
settings.description: How long AutoFish will wait if it doesn't get a bite before reeling in.

settings.name: Debug draw
settings.description: Shows where bites are occurring and where they will be detected. Useful for optimizing your 'Valid range' setting.

settings.name: DD color
settings.description: Color of the debug draw, if enabled.

settings.name: Stop when out of rods
settings.description: If enabled, AutoFish will turn itself off when it runs out of fishing rods.

settings.name: Stop when inv full
settings.description: If enabled, AutoFish will turn itself off when your inventory is full.

settings.name: Shallow water warning
settings.description: Displays a warning message in chat when you are fishing in shallow water.

settings.name: mcMMO mode
settings.description:
If enabled, AutoFish will cycle between two different fishing spots to bypass mcMMO's overfishing mechanic.

All other mcMMO settings will do nothing if this is disabled.

settings.name: mcMMO range
settings.description:
The value of mcMMO's MoveRange config option. This is the minimum distance between two fishing spots needed to avoid overfishing.

mcMMO only cares about the position of the bobber, so you don't need to move your character unless some other anti-AFK plugin is present.

settings.name: mcMMO range bug
settings.description:
At the time of writing, there is a bug in mcMMO's range calculation, meaning the default range of 3 blocks is actually just 2 blocks.

Uncheck this box if they ever fix it.

settings.name: mcMMO limit
settings.description: The value of mcMMO's OverFishLimit config option. Overfishing starts at this value, so you can actually only catch (limit - 1) fish from the same spot.

settings.name: Health
settings.description: Leaves the server when your health reaches this value or falls below it.

settings.name: Mode
settings.description:
§lQuit§r mode just quits the game normally.
Bypasses NoCheat+ but not CombatLog.

§lChars§r mode sends a special chat message that causes the server to kick you.
Bypasses NoCheat+ and some versions of CombatLog.

§lSelfHurt§r mode sends the packet for attacking another player, but with yourself as both the attacker and the target, causing the server to kick you.
Bypasses both CombatLog and NoCheat+.

settings.name: Disable AutoReconnect
settings.description: Automatically turns off AutoReconnect when AutoLeave makes you leave the server.

settings.name: Totems
settings.description:
Won't leave the server until the number of totems you have reaches this value or falls below it.

11 = always able to leave

settings.name: Wanted books
settings.description:
A list of enchanted books that you want your villagers to sell.

AutoLibrarian will stop training the current villager once it has learned to sell one of these books.

You can also set a maximum price for each book, in case you already have a villager selling it but you want it for a cheaper price.

settings.name: Lock in trade
settings.description:
Automatically buys something from the villager once it has learned to sell the book you want. This prevents the villager from changing its trade offers later.

Make sure you have at least 24 paper and 9 emeralds in your inventory when using this feature. Alternatively, 1 book and 64 emeralds will also work.

settings.name: Update books
settings.description:
Automatically updates the list of wanted books when a villager has learned to sell one of them.

§lOff§r - Don't update the list.

§lRemove§r - Remove the book from the list so that the next villager will learn a different book.

§lPrice§r - Update the maximum price for the book so that the next villager has to sell it for a cheaper price.

settings.name: Facing
settings.description:
How AutoLibrarian should face the villager and job site.

§lOff§r - Don't face the villager at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Face the villager on the server-side, while still letting you move the camera freely on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Face the villager by moving your camera on the client-side. This is the most legit option, but can be disorienting to look at.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How AutoLibrarian should swing your hand when interacting with the villager and job site.

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Repair mode
settings.description:
Prevents AutoLibrarian from using your axe when its durability reaches the given threshold, so you can repair it before it breaks.
Can be adjusted from 0 (off) to 100 remaining uses.

settings.name: Super fast mode
settings.description: Breaks blocks faster than you normally could. May get detected by anti-cheat plugins.

settings.name: Health
settings.description: Throws a potion when your health reaches this value or falls below it.

settings.name: Wait time
settings.description: Time before reconnecting in seconds.

settings.name: Death screen button
settings.description: Shows a button on the death screen that lets you quickly enable AutoRespawn.

settings.name: Health
settings.description: Eats a soup when your health reaches this value or falls below it.

settings.name: Omnidirectional Sprint
settings.description: Sprint in all directions, not just forward.

settings.name: Hungry Sprint
settings.description: Sprint even on low hunger.

settings.name: Delay
settings.description:
Delay between moving stacks of items.
Should be at least 70ms for NoCheat+ servers.

settings.name: Switch back
settings.description: Switches back to the previously selected slot after §lRelease time§r has passed.

settings.name: Release time
settings.description:
Time until AutoSword will switch back from the weapon to the previously selected slot.

Only works when §lSwitch back§r is checked.

settings.name: Use swords
settings.description: Uses swords to break leaves, cobwebs, etc.

settings.name: Use hands
settings.description: Uses an empty hand or a non-damageable item when no applicable tool is found.

settings.name: Repair mode
settings.description:
Prevents tools from being used when their durability reaches the given threshold, so you can repair them before they break.
Can be adjusted from 0 (off) to 100 remaining uses.

settings.name: Switch back
settings.description: After using a tool, automatically switches back to the previously selected slot.

settings.name: Show totem counter
settings.description: Displays the number of totems you have.

settings.name: Delay
settings.description: Amount of ticks to wait before equipping the next totem.

settings.name: Health
settings.description:
Won't equip a totem until your health reaches this value or falls below it.
0 = always active

settings.name: Natural Blocks
settings.description:
These blocks will be considered part of natural generation.

They will NOT be highlighted as player bases.

settings.name: Color
settings.description: Man-made blocks will be highlighted in this color.

settings.name: Limit
settings.description:
Automatically restarts Blink once the given number of packets have been suspended.

0 = no limit

settings.name: Change Forward Speed
settings.description: Allows §eForward Speed§r to be changed, disables smooth acceleration.

settings.name: Mode
settings.description:
§lFast§r mode can use bone meal on multiple blocks at once.
§lLegit§r mode can bypass NoCheat+.

settings.name: Automation
settings.description:
How much of the bone-mealing process to automate.
§lRight Click§r simply right clicks plants with the bone meal in your hand.
§lHotbar§r selects bone meal in your hotbar and then uses it on plants.
§lInventory§r finds bone meal in your inventory, moves it to your hotbar and then uses it.

settings.name: Crops
settings.description: Wheat, carrots, potatoes and beetroots.

settings.name: Stems
settings.description: Pumpkins and melons.

settings.name: Priority
settings.description:
Determines which entity will be attacked first.
§lDistance§r - Attacks the closest entity.
§lAngle§r - Attacks the entity that requires the least head movement.
§lAngle+Dist§r - A hybrid of Angle and Distance. This is usually the best at figuring out what you want to aim at.
§lHealth§r - Attacks the weakest entity.

settings.name: Predict movement
settings.description: Controls the strength of BowAimbot's movement prediction algorithm.

settings.name: Filter players
settings.description: Won't attack other players.

settings.name: Filter sleeping
settings.description:
Won't attack sleeping players.

Useful for servers like Mineplex that place sleeping players on the ground to make them look like corpses.

settings.name: Filter flying
settings.description:
Won't attack players that are at least the given distance above ground.

Useful for servers that try to detect your hacks by placing a flying bot near you.

settings.name: Filter hostile mobs
settings.description:
Won't attack hostile mobs like zombies and creepers.

This filter does not affect endermen, non-brute piglins, and zombified piglins.

settings.name: Filter neutral mobs
settings.description:
When set to §lOn§r, neutral mobs won't be attacked at all.

When set to §lIf calm§r, neutral mobs won't be attacked until they attack first. Be warned that this filter cannot detect if the neutral mobs are attacking you or someone else.

When set to §lOff§r, this filter does nothing and neutral mobs can be attacked.

settings.name: Filter passive mobs
settings.description:
Won't attack animals like pigs and cows, ambient mobs like bats, and water mobs like fish, squid and dolphins.

This filter does not affect wolves, bees, polar bears, pufferfish, and villagers.

settings.name: Filter passive water mobs
settings.description:
Won't attack passive water mobs like fish, squid, dolphins and axolotls.

This filter does not affect guardians, drowned, and pufferfish.

settings.name: Filter babies
settings.description:
Won't attack baby pigs, baby villagers, etc.

This filter does not affect baby zombies and other hostile baby mobs.

settings.name: Filter bats
settings.description: Won't attack bats and any other "ambient" mobs that might be added by mods.

settings.name: Filter slimes
settings.description:
Won't attack slimes.

This filter does not affect magma cubes.

settings.name: Filter pets
settings.description: Won't attack tamed wolves, tamed horses, etc.

settings.name: Filter villagers
settings.description: Won't attack villagers and wandering traders.

settings.name: Filter zombie villagers
settings.description: Won't attack zombified villagers.

settings.name: Filter golems
settings.description: Won't attack iron golems and snow golems.

settings.name: Filter piglins
settings.description:
When set to §lOn§r, piglins won't be attacked at all.

When set to §lIf calm§r, piglins won't be attacked until they attack first. Be warned that this filter cannot detect if the piglins are attacking you or someone else.

When set to §lOff§r, this filter does nothing and piglins can be attacked.

This filter does not affect piglin brutes.

settings.name: Filter zombie piglins
settings.description:

settings.name: ESP color
settings.description: Color of the box that BowAimbot draws around the target.

settings.name: Max attempts
settings.description:
Maximum number of random positions that BuildRandom will try to place a block at in one tick.

Higher values speed up the building process at the cost of increased lag.

settings.name: Check held item
settings.description:
Only builds when you are actually holding a block.
Turn this off to build with fire, water, lava, spawn eggs, or if you just want to right click with an empty hand in random places.

settings.name: Check line of sight
settings.description: Ensure that BuildRandom won't try to place blocks behind walls.

settings.name: Facing
settings.description:
How BuildRandom should face the randomly placed blocks.

§lOff§r - Don't face the blocks at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Face the blocks on the server-side, while still letting you move the camera freely on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Face the blocks by moving your camera on the client-side. This is the most legit option, but can be VERY disorienting to look at.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How BuildRandom should swing your hand when placing blocks.

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Always FastPlace
settings.description: Builds as if FastPlace was enabled, even if it's not.

settings.name: Place while breaking
settings.description:
Builds even while you are breaking a block.
Possible with hacks, but wouldn't work in vanilla. May look suspicious.

settings.name: Place while riding
settings.description:
Builds even while you are riding a vehicle.
Possible with hacks, but wouldn't work in vanilla. May look suspicious.

settings.name: Indicator
settings.description: Shows where BuildRandom is placing blocks.

settings.name: Area
settings.description:
The area around the player to search in.
Higher values require a faster computer.

settings.name: Limit
settings.description:
The maximum number of blocks to display.
Higher values require a faster computer.

settings.name: Color
settings.description: Caves will be highlighted in this color.

settings.name: Opacity
settings.description:
How opaque the highlights should be.
0 = breathing animation

settings.name: Your language
settings.description:
The main language that you can use and understand.

Your received messages will always be translated into this language (if enabled).

When "Detect sent language" is turned off, all sent messages are assumed to be in this language.

settings.name: Other language
settings.description:
The main language used by other players on the server.

Your sent messages will always be translated into this language (if enabled).

When "Detect received language" is turned off, all received messages are assumed to be in this language.

settings.name: Detect received language
settings.description:
Automatically detect the language of received messages.

Useful if other players are using a mix of different languages.

If everyone is using the same language, turning this off can improve accuracy.

settings.name: Detect sent language
settings.description:
Automatically detect the language of sent messages.

Useful if you're using a mix of different languages.

If you're always using the same language, turning this off can improve accuracy.

settings.name: Filter own messages
settings.description:
Won't translate messages that appear to be sent by you.

It tries to detect your messages based on common chat formats like "<name>", "[name]", or "name:". This might not work correctly on some servers.

settings.name: Scale
settings.description: How large the nametags should be.

settings.name: Unlimited range
settings.description: Removes the 64 block distance limit for nametags.

settings.name: See-through mode
settings.description: Renders nametags on the see-through text layer. This makes them easier to read behind walls, but causes some graphical glitches with water and other transparent things.

settings.name: Always show named mobs
settings.description: Displays the nametags of named mobs even when you are not looking directly at them.

settings.name: Always show player names
settings.description: Displays your own nametag as well as any player names that would normally be disabled by scoreboard team settings.

settings.name: Show reasons
settings.description: Highlights the block that caused each chunk to be marked as new/old.

settings.name: Show counter
settings.description: Shows the number of new/old chunks found so far.

settings.name: Log chunks
settings.description: Writes to the log file when a new/old chunk is found.

settings.name: All GUIs
settings.description: Removes the background for all GUIs, not just inventories.

settings.name: Allow elytra
settings.description:
Also tries to prevent fall damage while you are flying with an elytra.

§c§lWARNING:§r This can sometimes cause you to stop flying unexpectedly.

settings.name: Pause for mace
settings.description:
Pauses NoFall when holding a mace, so that you can take advantage of the mace's fall distance bonus.

§c§lWARNING:§r You will not be protected from fall damage while you are holding a mace. Also, switching to or away from a mace while you are already falling will interrupt your fall, potentially causing you to take damage.

settings.name: Offset
settings.description: The amount to lower the fire overlay by.

settings.name: Blocking offset
settings.description: The amount to lower the shield overlay by when blocking.

settings.name: Non-blocking offset
settings.description: The amount to lower the shield overlay when not blocking.

settings.name: Shape
settings.description: §lNote:§r If your range is set too high, the cube shape will start to look like a sphere because you can't reach the corners. Ranges 1-3 work best for the cube shape.

settings.name: Flat mode
settings.description: Won't break any blocks below your feet.

settings.name: Mode
settings.description:
§lNormal§r mode simply breaks everything around you.

§lID§r mode only breaks the selected block type. Left-click on a block to select it.

§lMultiID§r mode only breaks the block types in your MultiID List.

§lSmash§r mode only breaks blocks that can be destroyed instantly (e.g. tall grass).

settings.name: Items
settings.description: Item(s) to be restocked.

settings.name: Slot
settings.description: To which slot should we restock.

settings.name: Minimum amount
settings.description: Minimum amount of items in hand before a new round of restocking is triggered.

settings.name: Tools repair mode
settings.description:
Swaps out tools when their durability reaches the given threshold, so you can repair them before they break.
Can be adjusted from 0 (off) to 100 remaining uses.

settings.name: Sneak at edges
settings.description: Visibly sneak at edges.

settings.name: Sneak edge distance
settings.description:
How close SafeWalk will let you get to the edge before sneaking.

This setting is only used when "Sneak at edges" is enabled.

settings.name: Block
settings.description: The type of block to search for.

settings.name: Area
settings.description:
The area around the player to search in.
Higher values require a faster computer.

settings.name: Limit
settings.description:
The maximum number of blocks to display.
Higher values require a faster computer.

settings.name: Mode
settings.description:
§lPacket§r mode makes it look like you're sneaking without slowing you down.
§lLegit§r mode actually makes you sneak.

settings.name: Turn off while flying
settings.description:
Automatically disables Legit Sneak while you are flying or using Freecam, so that it doesn't force you to fly down.

Keep in mind that this also means you won't be hidden from other players while doing these things.

settings.name: Shape
settings.description: §lNote:§r If your range is set too high, the cube shape will start to look like a sphere because you can't reach the corners. Ranges 1-3 work best for the cube shape.

settings.name: Flat mode
settings.description: Won't break any blocks below your feet.

settings.name: Mode
settings.description:
§lNormal§r mode simply breaks everything around you.

§lID§r mode only breaks the selected block type. Left-click on a block to select it.

§lMultiID§r mode only breaks the block types in your MultiID List.

§lSmash§r mode only breaks blocks that can be destroyed instantly (e.g. tall grass).

settings.name: ID
settings.description:
The type of block to break in ID mode.
air = won't break anything

settings.name: Lock ID
settings.description: Prevents changing the ID by clicking on blocks or restarting the hack.

settings.name: MultiID List
settings.description: The types of blocks to break in MultiID mode.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How SpeedNuker should swing your hand when mining.

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Mode
settings.description:
§lSimple§r mode can step up multiple blocks (enables Height slider).
§lLegit§r mode can bypass NoCheat+.

settings.name: Height
settings.description: Only works in §lSimple§r mode.

settings.name: Amount
settings.description: Amount of uses per click.

settings.name: Range
settings.description: How far Tillaura will reach to till blocks.

settings.name: MultiTill
settings.description:
Tills multiple blocks at once.
Faster, but can't bypass NoCheat+.

settings.name: Check line of sight
settings.description:
Prevents Tillaura from reaching through blocks.
Good for NoCheat+ servers, but unnecessary in vanilla.

settings.name: Speed
settings.description:
Attack speed in clicks per second.
0 = dynamically adjusts the speed to match your attack cooldown.

settings.name: Priority
settings.description:
Determines which entity will be attacked first.
§lDistance§r - Attacks the closest entity.
§lAngle§r - Attacks the entity that requires the least head movement.
§lHealth§r - Attacks the weakest entity.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How TP-Aura should swing your hand when attacking.

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Pause on containers
settings.description:
Won't attack while a container screen (chest, hopper, etc.) is open.
Useful for minigame servers that display chest-like menus.

settings.name: Filter players
settings.description: Won't attack other players.

settings.name: Filter sleeping
settings.description:
Won't attack sleeping players.

Useful for servers like Mineplex that place sleeping players on the ground to make them look like corpses.

settings.name: Filter flying
settings.description:
Won't attack players that are at least the given distance above ground.

Useful for servers that try to detect your hacks by placing a flying bot near you.

settings.name: Filter hostile mobs
settings.description:
Won't attack hostile mobs like zombies and creepers.

This filter does not affect endermen, non-brute piglins, and zombified piglins.

settings.name: Filter neutral mobs
settings.description:
When set to §lOn§r, neutral mobs won't be attacked at all.

When set to §lIf calm§r, neutral mobs won't be attacked until they attack first. Be warned that this filter cannot detect if the neutral mobs are attacking you or someone else.

When set to §lOff§r, this filter does nothing and neutral mobs can be attacked.

settings.name: Miss Color
settings.description: Color of the trajectory when it doesn't hit anything.

settings.name: Entity Hit Color
settings.description: Color of the trajectory when it hits an entity.

settings.name: Block Hit Color
settings.description: Color of the trajectory when it hits a block.

settings.name: Range
settings.description: How far TreeBot will reach to break blocks.

settings.name: Facing
settings.description:
How TreeBot should face the logs and leaves when breaking them.

§lOff§r - Don't face the blocks at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Face the blocks on the server-side, while still letting you move the camera freely on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Face the blocks by moving your camera on the client-side. This is the most legit option, but can be disorienting to look at.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How TreeBot should swing your hand when breaking logs and leaves.

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Speed
settings.description:
Attack speed in clicks per second.
0 = dynamically adjusts the speed to match your attack cooldown.

settings.name: Speed randomization
settings.description:
Helps you bypass anti-cheat plugins by varying the delay between attacks.

±100ms is recommended for Vulcan.

0 (off) is fine for NoCheat+, AAC, Grim, Verus, Spartan, and vanilla servers.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How TriggerBot should swing your hand when attacking. (This setting will be ignored if "Simulate mouse click" is enabled.)

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Attack while blocking
settings.description:
Attacks even while you're blocking with a shield or using items.

This would not be possible in vanilla and won't work if "Simulate mouse click" is enabled.

settings.name: Simulate mouse click
settings.description:
Simulates an actual mouse click (or key press) when attacking. Can be used to trick CPS measuring tools into thinking that you're attacking manually.

§c§lWARNING:§r Simulating mouse clicks can lead to unexpected behavior, like in-game menus clicking themselves. Also, the "Swing hand" and "Attack while blocking" settings will not work while this option is enabled.

settings.name: Limit
settings.description:
Automatically stops once the tunnel has reached the given length.

0 = no limit

settings.name: Place torches
settings.description: Places just enough torches to prevent mobs from spawning inside the tunnel.

settings.name: Flat mode
settings.description: Won't break any blocks below your feet.

settings.name: MultiID List
settings.description: The types of blocks to mine as veins.

settings.name: Swing hand
settings.description:
How VeinMiner should swing your hand when mining.

§lOff§r - Don't swing your hand at all. Will be detected by anti-cheat plugins.

§lServer-side§r - Swing your hand on the server-side, without playing the animation on the client-side.

§lClient-side§r - Swing your hand on the client-side. This is the most legit option.

settings.name: Max vein size
settings.description: Maximum number of blocks to mine in a single vein.

settings.name: Check line of sight
settings.description: Makes sure that you don't reach through walls when breaking blocks.

settings.name: Ores
settings.description:
A list of blocks that X-Ray will show. They don't have to be just ores - you can add any block you want.

Remember to restart X-Ray when changing this setting.

settings.name: Only show exposed
settings.description:
Only shows ores that would be visible in caves. This can help against anti-X-Ray plugins.

Remember to restart X-Ray when changing this setting.

settings.name: Opacity
settings.description:
Opacity of non-ore blocks when X-Ray is enabled.

Does not work when Sodium is installed.

Remember to restart X-Ray when changing this setting.
